text: [music playing]
TRAY: Yo, Bobby.

- NYPD.
- Come on, man.
Put your hands in the air.

TRAY (VOICEOVER): The night I
got arrested was 15 years ago.
Barker, you ready?

As ready as your wife is
after a shot of Hennessy.

When I went away my neighborhood
was hanging on by a thread
thanks to dealers like me.
It's good to be back, be back.

This time, I'm gonna be a
force for positive change.
I used to be just like y'all.

You need to think about
your potential, man.
Actually, sorry to interrupt.

We're just waiting
for our friend.

[squeal] Let's go
to brunch, bitches.
[squeal]
That's right.

Everybody in my house
got to get a job.

Can I get a half caf, no
foam mocha latte with sugar

and an extra shot of espresso,
but split into two cups.
[shout]

What the fuck
happened to Brooklyn?
Brooklyn!

SHAY: 15 years you
been out of my life.

You think you just going to be
able to walk right back in it?
I got me a smartphone.

I'm in the middle
of a meeting.

OK.
TRAY: Damn.
That's your office.
Nice.
There she is, looking beautiful.
Oh, she got a roommate.
A white dude!
[grunt]

You thought she was just
going to wait for you.

- She just got lost.
- Yeah.

She got lost on another
man's bouncy house.
[laugh]

I feel like Rip Van Winkle
in this mother [bleep],, and I
don't even know who he is.
So what you been doing?
Trying to get this weed off.

You gonna end up
in prison, Bobby.
Nobody's scared of prison.

In prison, as pretty as you
are, you would be a perfect 10.
Thank you, man.
That's not good, Bobby.

You got some kind
of nerve coming up

here crashing my event,
looking like Big Bird.
Mom.
Go inside.

I know what you want to say.
- How are old are they?

How did you and
a Caucasian man

make two kids whose last name
could be Wesley and Snipes?
This where it all started.

This place brings
back a lot of memories.
Hey.

Get the [bleep] back before
I knock your ass out, bitch.

Just asking if
you had a moment
to save the polar icecaps.

TRAY (VOICEOVER): Second
chances are a beautiful thing.
